insolvency in 1997, mobile phone development and manufacturing business acquired by Telital in 1998[6]
Acquired by BenQ Corporation in 2005 to form BenQ Mobile
After having a majority acquired by VinSmart/Vingroup in 2018, BQ ceased operations; liquidating in 2020.
Phase out in 2013, in favour of its current operations as Telkom Mobile
Established in 2014 following the acquisition of Nokia's Devices and Services division by Microsoft, defunct in 2017
Subsidiary of Vingroup. (Production closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sales and services for VinSmart smartphones still continue to operate)

Sub-brand of Vietnam Telecommunications and Electronic Cables Joint Stock Company (VINACAP) - a subsidiary of VNPT. The brand was launched for the low-end market and targeted to users of Vinaphone's services. The brand ceased operation in circa 2016 due to poor sales.
